reviews.text: Mercat Sagrada Familia is a good neighbourhood Fresh food Market. There are lots of stalls offering really fresh fruit and vegetables, as well as meat, fish and smallgoods, and of course many other items too. The prices are good and you can eat in or take away.
Popped in to the market and stopped at Mercat for coffee but also had the heuvas potatoes which comes with bread. Tasty food.
You will find typical local food here year- round! From olives to fuet, ham, all kinds of cheeses (even imported ones), pastries, even some handcrafts. Looking forward to returning to it!
Everything looked so fresh and good.  Pretty much everything you need in one place.  There are also a couple of bars you can eat at.  Didn't but it looked very good.

This food market is just a block away from the Sagrada Familia.    We are always interested in a local market and this is a very good one!  It sells all the food you could possibly want and imagine!  All was fresh and clean and well worth a visit.  Meat, fish, vegetables and more.  If you are interested in local and good quality food this is a great place to visit. There's a good tapas bar with a nearby and spacious  courtyard with tables and chairs.
